0.user_question: John buys 2 pairs of shoes for each of his 3 children.  They cost $8553000 each.  How much did he pay?

ost_step.1: John bought two pairs of shoes per child.
ost_step.2: This means that he bought 2 * 3 = 6 pairs altogether (for all three kids).
ost_step.3: Each pair costs $8553000 so six would cost him 6 * $8553000 =$51318000.
ost_step.4: Therefore, John paid $51318000 for the shoe purchases.
